channel.title: X86 Compiler help
channel.description:
Sorry for the nooby question, but when I try to run my compiler I get this: Edit: Also sorry for not posting this in the huge Compiler Questions topic, I just didn't think it would get read if I put it in there :(
[code] Unrecognized option: -d Could not create the Java virtual machine. Press any key to continue . . . [/code] My compiler looks like this: [code] @echo off "c:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause [/code]
I'm just wondering how I can make this normal so I can compile my crap :o Thanks. Rep to any helpers.
Additional Info- I'm running a 317. It's Project Insanity. I will give an e-hug to anyone who helps :)

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @fish_o_mighty fish o mighty
item.description:
@fish_o_mighty wrote:

None of these suggestions work

Read full topic

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Code: [Select] @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile cd src for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/... :end echo Finished! pause exit

You really should learn some basic batch file syntax.


that was just one of my compilers that i had on a old server and it works fine for me.

Read full topic

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @fish_o_mighty fish o mighty
item.description:
@fish_o_mighty wrote:

Looks like it would hurt for you to brush up on your skills aswell.

The system cannot find the path specified.
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

@echo off
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
cd src
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is
about to load.
"%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/...
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

You really should learn some basic batch file syntax.

Read full topic

Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/... :end echo Finished! pause exit

you don’t need to change the JDK version

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause Right click on your compiler and the click edit, and erase everything in it and put this in it and it, Save and Exit it should work

Read full topic

item.title: X86 Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @fish_o_mighty fish o mighty
item.description:
@fish_o_mighty wrote:

Sorry for the nooby question, but when I try to run my compiler I get this:
Edit: Also sorry for not posting this in the huge Compiler Questions topic, I just didn’t think it would get read if I put it in there 

Unrecognized option: -d
Could not create the Java virtual machine.
Press any key to continue . . .

My compiler looks like this:

@echo off
"c:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe"  -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
pause

I’m just wondering how I can make this normal so I can compile my crap :o
Thanks. Rep to any helpers.

Additional Info-
I’m running a 317.
It’s Project Insanity.
I will give an e-hug to anyone who helps
